author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...AIRCRAFT DATA SUGGEST THAT MELISSA COULD BE REFORMING TO THE EAST... ...LIFE-THREATENING AND CATASTROPHIC FLASH FLOODING AND LANDSLIDES EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN HISPANIOLA AND JAMAICA THROUGH THE WEEKEND...
summary: ...AIRCRAFT DATA SUGGEST THAT MELISSA COULD BE REFORMING TO THE EAST... ...LIFE-THREATENING AND CATASTROPHIC FLASH FLOODING AND LANDSLIDES EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN HISPANIOLA AND JAMAICA THROUGH THE WEEKEND... As of 11:00 AM EDT Fri Oct 24 the center of Melissa was located near 15.7, -74.6 with movement ESE at 2 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1001 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...AIRCRAFT DATA SUGGEST THAT MELISSA COULD BE REFORMING TO THE EAST... ...LIFE-THREATENING AND CATASTROPHIC FLASH FLOODING AND LANDSLIDES EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN HISPANIOLA AND JAMAICA THROUGH THE WEEKEND... As of 11:00 AM EDT Fri Oct 24 the center of Melissa was located near 15.7, -74.6 with movement ESE at 2 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1001 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Melissa (AT3/AL132025)
